description: From ampelidaceae +‎ -aceous, from translingual Ampelidaceae (“former name of Vitaceae”), from Ancient Greek ἄμπελος (ámpelos, “grapevine”) + -ίδης (-ídēs, “-son, indicating a familial connection”) + -aceae (“-aceous, resembling”).

entries.meaning: (botany, obsolete) Of or belonging to the Ampelidaceae (now Vitaceae).
